intro: Alkanna alba, commonly known as white alkanna, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine, soft hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Alkanna alba is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine.
